intro: Inga fragrans, commonly known as the sweet shower tree, is a tropical species native to Central and South America. It is a leguminous plant belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid climates make it a valuable species for reforestation and ornamental purposes. The plant also has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility.
